message.body: Borges!
Hello!
hi, is this working? i didnt make a gtalk account
I just got your text. So I guess so. Do u like Borges?
Wonderful. yeah i had his map story on my mind when i was filling out the form. cant remember the title...
What's it about?
Geographers set out to make a map that includes every possible point and detail. the map ends up stretching over the earth's surface and is identical t
o the thing it represents
Oh I've read that one. I can't stop thinking about this one about the guy who remembers everything
He ends up just sitting and remembering remembering.
Funes! yeah that one is great. he strangely turns to gold at the end?
I don't remember. :(
I picked my name because of author and researcher sherry turkle.
Im totally unfamiliar,what is her area of research?
She's interested in our relationships with our technology
She's a psychologist
She has an amazing Ted talk
Anyway it's very different from Borges but I love them both
That sounds great. im really interested in psychology, but from a literary perspective. i read a lot of frued and lacan (but that's psychoanalysis i suppose)
I've always wanted to read Lacan! I should. I think I'd really like psychoanalysis. My thesis advisor is getting a doctorate psychoanalysis. I was thinking of going to her school to try it out.
Would be cool to learn something abt contemporary psych
So why did u sign up for this study?
former ldc employee. also just find their projects really interesting+fun
Yeah I thought this project sounded cool.
I like to text, too. So I was curious if I would enjoy texting with strangers as much as with friends
I worked on another study at ldc called mixer, in which i had 30min, meandering conversations with people in a soundproof room.
It was really fun
Hahaha
How did it turn out?
I bet what did u end up meandering about?
A lot of the participants were veterans, so the conversations steered in that direction
Either encouraging me to enlist or telling me abt hazing techniques
Or both
Hazing techniques?
Would you be interested in enlisting?
remember the details. i know you have to get very drunk and swim thru something
A navy vet told me abt getting "shellback", which i think means that you've crossed the equator. but before receiving the title you get hazed. i dont
I dont think i could enlist, for a variety of reasons
Would you consider it?
I don't know. I've never really thought about it. I've always be a skinny hippie intellectual, never seemed that it was for me.
What about u?
Same. at some point i started to feel some guilt for avoiding that path, tho
Yeah i think that's normal.
Bc my cousin enlisted
We are all different, And we all contribute to the world in different ways. I'd like to do so in a way that I can really excel at though
Oh yeah where is he or she?
But, in retrospect, that is the wrong reason to enlist!
Of course but its never too late
What do you do now?
In japan right now
Cool. What for
Hey, sry. im an adjunct instructor at temple
I just finished a poetry mfa, now im teaching creative writing+freshman comp
A student unexpectedly showed up at the office--i was distracted
Ooh yeah. I went to a literary/poetry conference this year
At Harvard
oh cool. what was the topic/what brought you there?
I went to see my friend Cecilia read.
But ended up running into a bunch of penn and high school friends. It was awesome.
I live in boston. But was in Philly for a long time
The literary circle seems very tight knit.
It definitely is...was cecilia a philly poet? i might know her
Yeah now she's in ny
I went to penn with her
Hey I have a question
How do we donate this conversation
Do we have to do anything
Oh, yeah im reading with her this summer. funny!
Oh such a small world
Not sure. planning to reread the guidelines when i get home
These studies are funny. while editing audio for the last project i noticed that most people only had 1 or 2 degrees of separation from the other
Yeah well Philly is also tiny.
We used to joke that you can't tell anyone who you sleep with, cause they've probably slept with that person themself
That's about right. i moved to south philly recently and feel like i have a somewhat renewed interest in the city
Opened up new social spheres. but still i might like to move soon. maybe this coming winter
I was in fishtown.
I loved it there
El bar!!!
But now it's so hipster city
I just went to a show at the pig iron theater on 2nd and master--really beautiful buildings around there.
Yeah that's my feeling abt fishtown in general these days
Yeah I love the industrial landscape.
Yeah.
Do you like boston?
It's different
I moved here for school
So i spend a lot of time working.
Most people here are young professionals
I havent been there in forever. fond memories of the aquarium
Good cuttlefish
I've never been!
